Dear yenata,

Terima kasih telah meluangkan waktu untuk menulis komentar di Trip Advisor. text: Hotel dengan nuansa klasik dan penuh benda bersejarah. Salah satu kamar didedikasikan khusus untuk proklamator Indonesia, Soekarno. Bagi penyuka keindahan sejarah dan ketenangan suasana, hotel Tugu Blitar layak dijadikan pilihan. Staf hotel ramah dan siap membantu apapun kebutuhan. Letak hotel strategis, dekat alun-alun (city hall) dan pusat kota. Hanya 15 menit ke lokasi makam Soekarno. Makanan dan restonya dibuat terbuka, menikmati makanan dengan dikelilingi ornamen klasik bersejarah. Sangat indah.

Dear Yulius K,

Kami menyampaikan terima kasih telah meluangkan waktunya untuk meninggalkan komentar yang sangat bagus selama tinggal bersama kami. 
Sang Fajar Presidential Suite, sebuah kamar yang dirancang sebagai penghormatan kepada presiden pertama Indonesia, Soekarno. Kamar ini mengukuhkan kembali esensi roman dan keanggunan tahun 1940-an yang dilengkapi dengan memorabilia dan benda-benda yang identik dengan Soekarno yang memunculkan pesona masa lampau di Indonesia. 
Ornamen klasik yang ada merupakan sebagian koleksi owner yang sebagian besar dapat dijumpai di property Tugu lain yang ada di Indonesia.
Kami selalu menunggu kedatangannya kembali untuk dapat menikmati pengalaman yang lain selama tinggal bersama kami.

Salam hangat,
Hartini S.

text:
Kami menyukai hotel ini karena suasananya yang unik dan antik.  Walaupun terkesan lama tetapi bersih.

Kami memilih tipe kamar Deluxe karena ingin kamar mandi dengan shower, sedangkan untuk tipe Standard kamar mandinya masih dengan bak mandi.
Kamar tidur bersih, sprei bersih dan kualitas tidur sangat nyaman.

Hanya kurang 'privacy' karena jalan masuk kamar-kamar yang lain melalui teras setiap kamar.  Apabila menginginkan privacy, lebih baik memilih kamar yang paling pojok.  Selain itu apabila tamu di kamar sabelah sedang duduk berbincang di teras, maka suaranyapun akan terdengar dari kamar.

Makan paginya juga enak dan cara penyajian nasi pecel juga unik.  Yaitu di daun pisang.

Kami sempat melihat Suite Sang Fajar dengan diantar guide yang sangat informatif.  Kamar ini sangat nyaman dan luas.  Suasana khidmat juga terasa.

Keseluruhan perjalanan ke Blitar menjadi lebih sempurna dengan menginap di Tugu Blitar.
title: Mengesankan

text:

Tapi semua itu ditampikan setelah mengetahui bahwa, hotel ini termasuk hotel yg memiliki sejarah panjang, dan keramahan sambutan seluruh staff hotelnya. 
Hotel dengan suasana tenang ini, sangat mendukung saya yg bukan hanya sekedar menginap saja tetapi juga sambil mengerjakan tugas dinas di Kota Blitar. 
Yg paling saya nikmati adalah pada saat Tea Time di sore hari yg merupakan bagian dr layanan Hotel, sambil kerja, diskusi dgn rekan, tapi juga Ngobrol para staf yg menjelaskan banyak tentang hotel ini... dn ga lupa Teh Hangat + Jajanan Pasar tradisional, Gratissss. 
Soal Lokasi, cocok dan Strategis. di pusat kota, bahkan cm 5 menit dr Stasiun KA, Pass banget lah. 
Lain waktu, selain belum sempat berwisata dan berziarah ke Makam Bung Karno, sudah barang tentu Inshaa Allah kembali lagi ke Kota Blitar, Hotel Tugu menjadi pilihan pertama utk saya.

text: Untuk keduakalinya saya menginap di hotel Tugu Sri Lestari setelah 5 tahun yg lalu juga stay cukup lama di hotel terbaik di kota Blitar ini. Waktu 5 tahun tidak membawa perubahan apapun bagi hotel ini. Segalanya masih sama persis, mulai dari lobby, restoran dan kamarnya. Saya berharap ada perbaikan atau renovasi pada kamar-kamarnya, namun ternyata saya harus kecewa karena harapan saya tidak terpenuhi. Kamar deluxe excecutive yg saya tempati kondisinya sama persis dg 5 th lalu. Yg beda hanya lubang besar di kamar mandi yg telah ditutup glass block (Thank God, karena lubang besar itu dulu membuat saya gelisah saat mandi). Bahkan televisinya juga masih menggunakan televisi tabung. Furniture kamar terkesan kuno. Yang agak mengganggu, banyak nyamuk di dalam kamar. Sepertinya sudah saatnya kamar direnovasi. Kelebihan hotel ini adalah service nya yang excellent dan  keramahan setiap petugas hotelnya. Yang paling berkesan bagi saya adalah setiap pagi saya minta kopi untuk diantar ke kamar, dan itu sebagai compliment! Breakfastnya juga enak, meskipun kadang tidak buffet, namun rasa dan kualitasnya oke. Satu  lagi, setiap sore ada tea time, hotel menyediakan snack dan teh bagi seluruh tamu.
title: Service  excellent, namun kamar perlu renovasi

text: saya menginap disini selama satu malam pada tanggal 23 mei 2015. overall menurut saya kesan pertama memasuki hotel ini adalah etnik. penuh dengan nuansa tradisional. staffnya pun sangat lah ramah terhadap semua customer. saya menempati kamar tipe executive. memang kondisi kamar ya cukup lumayan untuk hotel di kota blitar, tapi kesan unik dan antik saat memasuki kamar mandi. kamar mandinya mengusung konsep outdoor dan tentunya memiliki bathub yang lain dari hotel biasanya. bathub yang ada sangatlah tradisional yaitu terbuat dari lantai, bukan terbuat dari marmer seperti umunya. untuk ukuran bathub nya pun tergolong cukup luas. konsep spa, cafe (waroeng djawa) sangatlah berkonsep tradisional. hotel tugu tetap tidak lupa untuk menampilkan berbagai macam bentuk patung serta koleksi terdahulu seperti lukisan soekarno, uang jamn dahulu,dll. sangat disayangkan, variasi makanan yang disajikan di restoran pada saat sarapan kurang bervariasi. tapi overall is good.

text:
Sudah cukup lama saya tertarik untuk mencoba hotel yang tergabung dalam jaringan Tugu Hotel. Namun saya baru berkesempatan mencobanya ketika bepergian ke Blitar. 

Reservasi dapat dilakukan dengan mudah, cukup melalui telepon dengan menyebutkan jumlah dan tipe kamar yang diinginkan.
Tips: ada 1 tipe kamar yang tidak disebutkan di web Tugu Blitar. Kamar tersebut memiliki rate yang paling murah, dengan perbedaan tidak menyediakan air panas. Jika tidak memiliki masalah untuk mandi dengan air dingin,  cobalah untuk menanyakan availability kamar tersebut ketika reservasi.

Semua staff di sana ramah dan siap membantu. Saya bepergian dengan anak saya yang berumur 11 bulan, yang masih membutuhkan penanganan khusus untuk makanannya. Saya meminta tolong untuk menitip memanaskan makanan, dan itu bisa diakomodir dengan baik oleh staff yang bertugas.
Jikalau Sang Fajar Suite sedang tidak dihuni oleh tamu, maka staff juga menawarkan "tour" singkat mengenai kamar tersebut. Kita dapat melihat kamar yang jaman dahulu sempat dipergunakan oleh Soekarno (Presiden RI yang pertama).

Sekitar jam 16:00-18:00, tamu hotel akan mendapatkan jamuan teh komplimentari di warung yang berada di dekat lobi. Disediakan teh secara default (tapi kopi dapat diminta), beserta jajanan tradisional (singkong goreng, pisang rebus, dsb).

Untuk sarapan pagi, pilihannya ada dari nasi goreng, soto ayam, rawon, roti bakar, dsb.

Secara lokasi, letak hotel Tugu (dikenal sebagai Sri Lestari bagi penduduk lokal Blitar) sangat strategis. Bisa dijangkau dengan jalan kaki dari Alun-alun Kota Blitar, tidak terlalu jauh juga dari Stasiun Blitar.

Satu-satunya hal minus yang saya temui dari hotel ini adalah kamar mandi karena toiletnya bocor. Sebenarnya bisa ditutup dengan mudah (saya bisa menutupnya sendiri), tapi cukup menganggu karena harus membuka bagian atas toilet, memperbaiki posisi pelampungnya, di mana hal itu bukanlah sesuatu yang ingin kulakukan ketika menginap di hotel.
Ketika saya bepergian itu kebetulan saya mereservasi dua kamar, dan dua-duanya mengalami hal yang sama.
title: Hotel Bersejarah dengan Kualitas Prima

text:
Hotel Tugu berada di tengah Kota Blitar dengan nilai sejarah yang luar biasa bagi Indonesia. DI Hotel ini kita bisa melihat sebagian perjalanan hidup dari Presiden RI pertama Ir Soekarno. Ada kamar president suite yang disewakan dan merupakan kamar yang pernah ditinggali oleh Bung Karno. Di bagian resepsionis hotel terpampang foto, dan berbagai artikel serta barang-barang antik peninggalan Bung Karno. Memang hotel ini agak sedikit terasa mistis karena pintu masuk akan disambut rindangnya pohon beringin dan untaian akar tanaman merambat dengan lampu yang temaram.
Kamar hotel sangat bersih dan nyaman. Wangi cempaka menyambut saat kita membuka kamar hotel. Kamar mandi berada di belakang kamar dan terbuka namun tetap menjaga privasi kita. Ada yang unik saat pertama kali masuk ke kamar, di tempat tidur sudah ada welcome greeting berupa kartu ucapan selamat datang, buah, dan minuman. 
Sarapan di hotel ini juga sangat nikmat, dengan nasi pecel khas Jawa Timur atau rawon daging. Kita juga bisa mengunjungi kamar president suite secara gratis, itupun kalau beruntung saat dibersihkan.
title: Hotel Historis di Blitar, Jawa Timur

text:
Hotel tua yg lekat dgn Bung Karno. Konon, keluarga Bung Karno menempati kamar khusus jika datang ke Blitar dan menginap di hotel ini. Lingkungan hotel memang asri, penuh dgn tumbuhan, tp jika malam hari sedikit membuat bulu kuduk berdiri. Mungkin krn kamar saya ada d dekat pohon beringin.

Semua staf hotel (receptionist, housekeeping, security, dll) sangat ramah dan cekatan. Jika mreka mlihat ada tamu yg 'celingukan' krn bingung pasti mreka langsung mendekat dan menawarkan bantuan.
Kehangatan juga terasa saat kamu pertama kali datang dan dsuguhi kue2 'jaman dulu' dan the manis. Bbrp alat2 masak kuno juga dipajang sbg daya tarik.

Kebersihan hotel ini patut mendapat pujian. Semua fasilitas di dalam kamar, walaupun kuno tapi sangat bersih dan tertata rapi. 

Menu sarapan walaupun hanya sedikit tapi rasanya enak. Nasi pecelnya top!

Satu2nya kekurangan adalah menu room service terlalu mahal (mnurut ukuran dompet saya). Overall, saya puas dgn hotel ini

text: Blitar does not receive the number of visitors that the more popular cities attract such as Malang, Solo or Yogyakarta. Smaller and less hectic, tourists will find their way there to visit the grave of former president Sukarno, his house and museum dedicated to his memory. When he returned to his home town as president he did not stay in his house but had a suite in the Hotel Tugu Blitar. Consequently there is a real sense of history to the hotel which is in a converted Dutch colonial building dating from the 1850's. My wife and I stayed two nights in the Tugu Suite in the same building as Sukarno's suite which the hotel staff were kind enough to show us. The rooms in this building are incredibly atmospheric with high ceilings and wonderful teak beds. The staff are very welcoming and as well as breakfast we enjoyed afternoon tea. All in all a wonderfully enjoyable stay in such an historic hotel.
title: A Hidden Gem

text:
My husband and I spent three nights at Tugu Blitar in July 2019, and we loved every minute of our time there! 

Hotel & Room - the hotel consists of several beautiful, historical buildings that are well-maintained and overflowing with traditional Javanese charm. We especially appreciated the gorgeous entry way and the Djawa Cafe where they serve afternoon teas. The place is really at its height in the evening when they turn on hundreds of small lights that illuminate everything from the large shadow puppet statues to the hanging entryway. As for our room, we stayed in one of the Tugu Suites in the main historical building. The room was very large, comfortable, and clean. While it is decorated in a more traditional style (white walls, old paintings, antique furniture), everything was clean, and the bathroom had clearly been recently updated. I loved our room!! If you're traveling on a Western budget, it is a steal at less than $100/night.

Restaurant - We traveled around Java for a month, and I must say that the Tugu Blitar had some of the best vegetarian food we found, including in Yogyakarta! Although I don't eat meat, my husband seemed quite please with his chicken dishes as well. Try the Tahu Telor -- it was stellar and seemingly unique to East Java since I couldn't find it anywhere in Yogyakarta. The service at the restaurant was also great.

Tours - We took the full-day Coffee Plantation tour and then went to one of the beaches on the south coast. The Coffee Plantation tour was excellent. We met up with one of the managers of the plantation and got a private, in-depth tour of not only the coffee plants but the coffee factory, the bees they use to pollinate the coffee plantation, etc. It was super informative and interesting. Plus, the views from the coffee plantation are stunning. One of my favorite days in Java!! The beach was also quite nice. It was scenic, if not entirely clean. You can't swim in most of the southern beaches due to rip tides, but we walked along the shore, dipping our feet in. The beaches have basic bathroom and shower facilities, and our driver from Tugu was a great help. They packed us nice meals as well.

Service - Really, this is where Tugu Blitar shines! The staff at the hotel made me sad to leave. They were exceedingly polite and friendly but never intrusive. I speak bahasa Indonesia, and everyone from the waiters at the restaurant to the check-in desk were so kind and pleased with my language skills. I could have stayed at this hotel for a week. 

All around excellent place! I came to Blitar to see Sukarno's tomb (which was totally worth it), but I would return for Tugu Blitar and its great natural tours.
title: Excellent Stay at Tugu Blitar

text:
I have been here for a business trip, first time visit on May 2018 then came back on August 2018. I never ever had a services like they did. This hotel will serve you a truly Indonesian Hospitality in every single services that you got. You may see a rich Javanese Culture in this hotel.

I was booked for a deluxe room for the first time, since that was my first experience staying in Tugu Hotel. I was amazed, it is not a brand new room, but offering a very nice old style well maintained room. Then, i was offered to upgrade my room to the Tugu Suite, which is located in the main historical building (built in 1850). That such an incredible experience to stay in the historical building with a modern and well maintained stuffs inside. Never ever doubt for a sleeping experience since this hotel not only offer a great experience but really feeling as a this is your own palace. They treated you as a ‘King’ during your stay. The unforgettable things about Tugu Suite room is the bathroom. It was so marvelous with a semi-outdoor concept.

Then my second visit, i booked for a Sang Fajar Suite, the highest level of the suite with a deep concept : ‘dedicated’ to Indonesian First President, our Founding Father - His Excellency Ir. Soekarno.
It was a huge room, very antiques with a luxury touch inside. In my experience, i felt like I was a Javanese King for one night staying in the King’s room. Very excited, very unforgettable. The bed was soooo huge,and you need to take a small stairs to go up to the bed. It was very very very cool. Inside, they have a living room, dining table, a corner of historical Mr Soekarno Story and Stuffs, and many more. For you who want to know about history of our First President and want to feel living in a Truly Javanese Culture and Indonesian Hospitality this is a ‘must experience’ you should have.

Every afternoon, they also offer you a free coffee break with a variety of traditional snack that you may not find in other places.

Last but not least, I recommend this Hotel for you to have a very great Experience of Truly Indonesian Hospitality, experience living in the Truly Javanese Culture since they offer you a rich culture of Java in every single moment. Either you want to feel those experiences or find out more about history of Our Founding Father, this hotel is truly recommended for any experiences that you may not find in other places.
title: Truly Indonesian Hospitality

text: I spent a week staying at the Tugu Blitar after spending a week at the Tugu Malang. The Tugu Malang is a magical place and a hard act to follow. That being said the Tugu Blitar is a beautiful place with the old building oozing historical charm. Built by the colonial Dutch, the building is massively built with thick walls that really insulate the place. The rooms in the old building are quite large and unlike the Tugu Malang are not perfect but still very comfortable. I enjoyed the "not perfect" atmosphere as I have seen renovations that really suck the soul out of great old places. There is a hotel restaurant that had good food but I ate mostly room service which was also very good. Blitar is not itself a major tourist destination but a nice city that I enjoyed walking around. There was one street in particular where plants were sold that was very attractive. All in all I enjoyed my stay at the Blitar Tugu and would certainly return.
title: Historical Gem!

text: We bought three nights at this hotel through a charity auction and were not disappointed. The main building and entrance are beautiful and extremely atmospheric. The staff were wonderful - kind and helpful; they made us feel like family. The Indonesian food is delicious (particularly the nasi pecel) and we enjoyed daily afternoon tea. On our first full day, we went on a cycle tour, guided by Mas Najib, who was brilliant. We visited some very interesting home industries. The hotel organised a driver to take us to Mount Kelud and Penataran Temple on our second day and, on our third, the hotel organised becaks to take us to the traditional market, guided again by Mas Najib. Another great experience. We both enjoyed massages in the spa and, one evening, had a candlelit dinner in the hotel grounds. Just before leaving, one of the housekeeping staff helped us to orchestrate a "photo shoot" in the room stayed in by President Sukarno. We left with these photos and many other happy memories of our time at Tugu Blitar. Highly recommended.
title: Charming heritage hotel with delightful staff

text:
I'm not expecting this hotel will be nice at the first glance at the gate, it's a bit creepy with all the banyan root hanging over the hotel entrance. After i reach the parking lot, i can see the building is keep old ethnic style but not actually rotten. The staffs are very friendly and helpful.

The WiFi connection is fast. You can work from room, no need to go fetch WiFi in hotel lobby or corridor.

No swimming pool but they have spa. Very lovely Javanese style spa.

They will not clean your room if you don't ask. Leave your key to the reception desk when leaving. Since the key strap to a extra huge wooden key chain, you probably find it hard to keep in your pocket.

Hot water is there but you need to wait 3 to 5 minutes until the water gradually warm itself.

I stay at deluxe 504 on ground floor. So i don't need to climb the stairs since no lift in here. Car park is in front of the room. The parking space gives some lovely view.

For breakfast you can choose between egg fried rice, rawon (Javanese style soup: beef and sprout with black soup), pecel (Javanese style salad: vegetables, peanut sauce with rice), soto ayam (chicken soup).

They will send traditional Javanese snack to your room every afternoon.

They have gamelan class every Friday at 4pm. Ask the reception if you eager to learn.

Our first president once stay i this hotel, and now his family regularly come to stay 
in the same room. you can also rent that room for big amount of money. Or ask the staff to show you the room, there will be books and items which belong to our former president Ir. Soekarno.

This hotel located in the heart of blitar city. The train station is behind the hotel. City hall and market is in walking distance, or you can rent becak (Indonesian rickshaw). The main tourist destination here is the tomb of Ir. Soekarno, which is close to the hotel.

I don't find any taxi nor ojek here. And i don't recall seeing any local transport (angkot), becak will be the only transport you can get. Or ask the hotel to help you get around the city.
title: Awesome time traveling to the past

It could use a total makeover to meet the promise of the Tugu family of hotels.

text:
This is the most westernized restaurant in town. Especially the Javanese cuisine is good. Unfortunately they still do not know how a real steak looks like. They have onIy Rendang shape beef steaks. Guess this is the only place to get a wine with your meal.
Sweet service!
title: Oasis in a simple province town

text: This hotel brings you back in time. We were welcomed by friendly staff wearing their colonial outfits. Our luggage was brought to our rooms straight away and we found a warming welcome note on our beds. They arranged a free welcome drink at our rooms and we've been shown the presedential suite, which is available to rent (it's got a HUGE bed...and all sorts of historic items in it). The manager arranged a guide for us who has given us an invaluable personalised tour in Blitar and helped translating any historic facts! Thank you so much!! We loved staying at your hotel. The rooms are basic, clean and quiet. Perfect for a good nigbt sleep. Especially after the spa treatment which was also extraordinary using fresh spices.
title: The best of both worlds!

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I stayed for one night at Tugu Blitar with my friend and 2 young kids. As always, there are pros and cons of this establishment. Let me start with the pros:

1. First impression, this is a charming boutique hotel located right in the heart of a small town of Blitar. Small shops and eateries are literally at your doorstep.
2. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Check in process is quick and efficient, which was a big plus after a 6-hour drive and two tired kids. My friend had called them up 15 minutes prior to our arrival to make sure our rooms were ready. And they were.
3. Breakfast is pretty good. There's no buffet, but we got to choose from 4 menus. I had the nasi pecel & nasi rawon and it's really tasty.
4. The air con is cold, and I appreciated it as the hot & humid weather made us rather sticky.
5. The rooms are kept quite clean, despite the age of the property.
6. The price is very reasonable.

However, there are also rooms for improvement:
1. This is an old hotel and it shows. The decor is really tired and irrelevant. I get that they want to maintain a traditional feel. But it doesn't have to be old and mouldy. A change for furniture and fixtures could significantly improve this issue.
2. The hot water in our room was not running. A cold shower at 6AM wasn't really a pleasant way to start the day. (Luckily the nice hot coffee at breakfast remedied this). I checked with my friend and the hot water in their room was working just fine. So it could have been a plumbing problem in our room only.
3. The amenities are scarce. There's only a bar soap and shower cap. So do bring your own toiletries. I personally always do whenever I travel, but I just thought I should point this out for the sake of travellers who don't. Bath towels are provided.

I do hope the management does something to bring this hotel forward because I have enjoyed my stay at Tugu Blitar despite the small issues. If I ever had to spend overnight at Blitar again I wouldn't hesitate to stay at Tugu again.
title: Typical Traditional Indonesian

owner_response.text:
Dear jingga18,

Thank you very much for taking your time off to write a comment during stay with us through TripAdvisor.
Gladly we read your good comments about good breakfast, quick check in, good air con, and friendly staff.
On the other hand, we regret that you was very disappointed when staying with us with the condition of an old hotel, not running hot water and uncompleted amenities in room.
We will pay attention to this to make your next stay more comfortable. The decor should be maintained and cleaned well, all hot water in all rooms must be running well, and for the amenities have different standards depend on the room type; but we promise to make this better. 
Once again many thanks for your comment, looking forward to welcoming you soon. 

Best regards,
Hartini
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I spent 2 nights at the Hotel Tugu Blitar in late May, staying in one of the rooms OTHER THAN the high-end suites of the original building.  

My room was serviceable, period.  The space was limited, if adequate.  The shower was in a wet room that was separated from the vanity a bit.  There was no safe, luggage rack, or electirc kettle, but the room did have an empty mini-fridge, a nominal supply of toiletries, two (count them!) hangars, and – at least when I first arrived – a musty smell. FWIW, my glimpse of the original building, with its six suites, suggest that those who choose to pay for that option would have a much more luxurious stay than the rest of us!

My room rate included breakfast, which involved a buffet with a small selection of interesting Indonesian foods and a welcome offer of toast and juice.  I also ate dinner at the hotel both nights, and was pleased with my meals.

Shared areas of the hotel included several pleasant seating areas, a space decorated with local crafts in which tea was served each afternoon – complete with some tasty treats from the hotel’s kitchen, and a fan-cooled restaurant area.  The hotel also holds a spa, and OMG, I can’t say enough about my massage plus scrub there, or about the masseuse who provided that treatment!  And I must commend all of the hotel’s staff for their kind and helpful assistance – much appreciated!

So, although the room in which I chose to stay was basic, the hotel has many redeeming features and is, I think, worth considering if you choose to visit Blitar.
title: Some delightful features, with a WIDE gap between room options!

text: The staffs were so kind and friendly. In addition, there was a lot of things that we can not find in ordinal city hotels (the room where the first president Sukarno stayed,  a Javanese traditional old-fasshioned tea space and etc...). Although the facillity looks old to need maintenance, this hotel should be a good place If you want to feel Javanese traditional atmosphere.
title: A hotel where you can feel the good old days in Java

text: Lovely little place, very authentic. Good food, rooms are a bit small but somehow it belongs to this hotel. Bathroom was small and more like the Mandi shower style. I stayed in an ordinary room, maybe the deluxe or suites do have more space and better bathroom facilities. I enjoyed my stay! Friendly and helpful staff.
title: Going back to the old days

text:
Summary: we loved this hotel and its friendly and caring staff.  The hotel is a colonial masterpiece stuffed with antiquities from Indonesia and is worth visiting even if one plans to not spend a night.
We were given Room 7, a large room with an amazing four- poster bed – one so high that they provide step- stools to get into bed.  There is also a mini- fridge, TV, wardrobe and in the sitting area chairs and two tables.  The hotel supplied fresh fruit daily including star fruit, lichees and some exotics which I could not identify.  It took an hour or so until the Aircon got the room cooled down enough to be comfortable, and it stayed that way the rest of the visit.
The bedding was very comfortable and we slept very soundly.  The only noise was the morning prayers at 04:15 but they were not too loud, did not last long and were actually pleasant to listen to.
The bathroom was nice, with marble and good fittings.  The bathtub was a beautiful hammered metal tub.  The shower worked well and there was plenty of water pressure.  The room and bathroom were kept very clean the whole visit.
Breakfast was made to order.  You can choose Indo or Western.  Your choice of omelets, scrambled, boiled, poached, with toast, fruit, fruit juices, coffee, sweet roll and so on -  if you think of something they don’t offer, they are happy to give it to you if they have it.
There is a lounge area off the lobby, and they serve beers and a good selection of long drinks and anything you might care to order from the dinner menu as well – you do not have to sit in the restaurant to get a bite.
The restaurant was very good, and the menu carried more than 100 meal items, not counting drinks.  The fries were really good, in case you have a yearning for comfort food.  We had meals there several times, trying Indo and Western items and they were all tasty and well- prepared.  It is the only restaurant we saw in town which caters to Western tastes.
The hotel arranged a car to collect us and out luggage at the train station, which is 620m using the road.  If you knew the back way in, you could cut that to 350m.  The hotel is on the main street and only 370m from the entrance to Alum Alum, the town square, which is ringed with vendors.  There are numerous restaurants around, most of which do not offer alcohol.  So the location is great.
The rooms in the main colonial building are individual.  Some offer outdoor (walled) bathrooms.  Rooms 8 and 9 combine to create the largest room in the property, used regularly by Suekarno.  The hotel gave us a tour of the room and we could sit at his desk.  There were many memorabilia of note in the room – it is almost a mini- museum.
The Suekarno Museum is a few km, walkable but better served by cab if the day is hot.  There are numerous small temples in the area, most of which are not in the guide books.  The hotel can advise on local guides, who are not expensive.  
Blitar is definitely worth a stopover on the way from Jyogja to Malang (where another Tugu property is located, by the by.) Blitar is served by the Malioboro Express in addition to the slower trains.  
IHighly recommended.
title: A colonial masterpiece stuffed with antiquities

text:
Hotel Tugu Blitar is a special destination when visiting the small Javanese town of Blitar. From the moment you enter, you'll notice the attention to detail and the efforts to maintain a place where the first president of Indonesia often stayed. Ask the front desk to let you see his favorite room (#9 in the main building).

The standard rooms themselves are fine, although the bathroom is tight. There is no separation between the shower and toilet, so water gets everywhere. There are many atmospheric sitting areas throughout the complex, so find a nice place to read a book or browse your ipad. Breakfast is a modest choice between Indonesian dishes, but the pineapple jam with the eggs and toast is delicious.

Not too much to see in Blitar, except for President's Soekarno's tomb and memorial. There aren't many nice places to eat other than the local food options on Jalan Mastrip. The train station is a quick 10 minute walk away, which is very convenient for arrival and departure. For good Indonesian coffee, try VIP Coffee House on Jalan Merdeka/Ahmad Yani.
title: Historic and Atmospheric Hotel

text: Tugu Blitar was one of our main reasons to visit Blitar. It has a wonderful history. Perfect to wind down and take it very easy. Do pick a room in the main building and pay a bit more. The staff is super friendly, the architecture is special and everything is done in a very tasteful way, like you can expect from Tugu - it's probably its most low key property though.

text: I always enjoy my stay at Hotel Tugu Blitar. I stayed at this hotel for several times and I can say that the spirit of the people of Blitar can be seen through their honest service. The rooms are always clean, the breakfast is not fancy but I am fully satisfied with the taste. They have a strong WiFi connection and the staff are very kind, friendly, and helpful. At one occasion the hotel gave a welcome card which brought a personal touch in saying 'Welcome'. The first time I stayed I remember a hotel staff offered me to see the late Mr. Soekarno bed room and he even gave short explanation about the room - a great way to provide service for customers. I will definitely visit Blitar and Hotel Tugu will my first choice.
title: The Best Hotel in Blitar

text:
It's was very amazing to stay in this Hotel. The interior is very classic, colonial style. The service is very good. Location also good, in the central city of Blitar. When we stayed at this hotel, the hotel staff offered us to look at Sang Fajar Suite Room, the room dedicated for Soekarno, the 1st President of Indonesia. You can find many photos, painting and books about Soekarno. 
Breakfast are limited but delicious.
But the hotel management must improve the room facilities, like coffee and tea maker in standart and superior room.
title: Great Heritage Hotel in Blitar

text:
I booked the hotel in the morning and got upgraded since we asked for 3 rooms. My dad really loved it since his Executive Suite room located on ground level and he was on a wheelchair. The front office staffs were really nice and welcoming, he even gave us a nice tour around the the hotel. And I just knew the hotel was built in 1850!

Recommended for family!
title: Best Hotel in Blitar

text: when i visit blitar, we usually stay in this hotel, because cozy place and also have nice view. the room was cool and this hotel was one of historical place (because Indonesia first Presiden was stay here)
title: Historical Hotel

text:
Staying at this hotel make my mind blowing. The hotel keeps all stuff on old modes. The services were above excellence. Good people with humble smile keep trying to fulfill my needs.
The attitude and humbleness make me feel like in home.
Value for money, one of the best I've stayed in for the price I paid for
title: Comfortable, BEST services, old fashioned hotel!

text: Tugu Blitar is a pleasant heritage hotel with an impressive antique artwork collection on display throughout the hotel public space. The suite in the main building is very spacious, quiet, and elegantly furnished. The high platform bed is firm and comfortable and we had two very restful nights.  Clean bathroom with good quality toiletry and hairdryer. Shower head desires some improvement. The staff are courteous, flexible, and helpful. Excellent massage is available at very reasonable costs at the soothing and beautifully decorated Spa. Don’t miss it. The restaurant has a huge menu and makes good Javanese food, particularly tasty fried rice dishes. The only drawback was the traffic noises from the street which make the dining experience unpleasant.  The restaurant is located in an open area right next to the hotel entrance off the street... We enjoyed our two night stay and highly recommend this hotel to independent travelers.
title: Comfortable heritage property

text: Hotel Tugu Blitar is so nice to stay for a holiday in the country side. Quiet, delicious restaurant and very clean rooms. The afternoon tea with the delicious sweets is a must to try and it`s for free for hotel guests ! In the surroundings of Blitar are some interesting sites as the former house and grave of Sukarno, first president of Indonesia and a trip to the south coast is worth as well. The railway station is on walking distance from the Tugu hotel.
title: Very comfortable and quiet

text:
This is the 3rd Tugu hotel my husband and I have stayed in.  Living in Jakarta for a couple of years we wanted to know more on the historical side and decided to start at a place where it all started, Blitar.

Initially we booked the Tugu suite and decided to upgrade to Sang Fajar Suite after Ibu Hartini showed it to use.  Bearing in mind this is an off the main tourist village, the hotel is very well kept and maintain though I was thinking of the nice small cosy pool in Malang.

Typical Tugu, all food is good.  No matter simple dish or complicated.  Even their ikan asin nasi goreng taste good!

The artifacts in the suite are better maintain and displayed the the Sukarno museum. Maybe the hotel could offer some advise to the museum??

We also took their offer and book the private dinner at the Candi penataran.  It's was LOVELY, all the lights lit around, the soft flute. The place totally emptied out.  This is the 2nd oldest Hindu temple on Java island about 700yr after the first.  Place is very well maintain.  I totally recommend this to anyone coming this way.  Price may seem a bit steep compared to local food but it's for good cause to support the Candi which don't charge entrance fees.

We also had the hotel car took us to the beaches and also to look at other candis, beaches are nice as they are quiet and worth the visit.

On the last morning we took the bicycle tour, I didn't quite remember his name maybe Dodi? He was a very good guide.  We went thru rice fields, villages off track where some is in creative industry, ie they gather together and make products for export to Bali, China, etc.  incredible part is everywhere is clean.  Of course roads are not brand new and drains are broken down but there's no garbage thrown around, small lanes between houses are swept clean, there were some mosquitoes but not many and I didn't see any flies in the 3 days I was there.

I would strongly recommend if anyone going to Mt Bromo via Malang, take another day off and stay to discover.
title: Discover the old charm of indonesian village

text: Staying in Tugu Hotel in Blitar was a truly amazing experience. First of all, it was the most beautiful hotel we've seen for a long time. Every corner and space is thought about and taken care of, the garden is lush and tropical and all the ornaments and furniture are a treat for the eye. The staff here is excellent and the food, including the breakfast, mouthwatering. We stayed in a superior room which is good value. However, if you really want the full experience, consider staying in one of the luxury suites or even the old room of Sukarno himself. Yes, they are a bit pricey, but absolutely incredible (the friendly staff showed us around all off them and gave us a special tour of the Sukarno room). We had a magical stay, thank you!
title: Wonderful and georgeous hotel, truly special stay.

text:
This was our second Tugu Hotel after the one in Malang and we chose a standard room. It is not as nice as the first one. The hotel is fine, a bit rustic as if the owner is not quite finished with it. The reception area is small and unimpressive, the dining area OK and the food quite good and reasonable. 
Our standard room was a disappointment as it was in need of refurbishment, the AC barely adequate, a weird bed that had a step to get up about 50cm to reach it ! Better not fall out !
As other have said it seems best to go for the Superior room. In our case the hotel was almost empty so they should have upgraded us . 
The neighbourhood is nothing special or attractive.
Had a massage in the spa - one of the best I have ever had, very reasonable too.
title: Great Potential

text: Decided to come back to this hotel after a bit dissapointed last time. But now I realized that you have to use at least superior room to get the awesome service and facilities. With only around 50k different price between the cheapest and superior, I recommend to choose at least the superior class. It is much better and this hotel is still the best in Blitar :)
title: Much better

text:
Unique old hotel, surrounding by big and old trees. The main entrance is covered by tree canopy and old Dutch building with antique furnishing. Instantly, it will bring you back into nostalgic and traditional atmosphere. Room is not so big but clean with old fashion floor. WIFI available in all room and quite fast.
Tea or coffee along with traditional snack are served in 4:00 PM for free. Staffs are very friendly and helpful.
Unfortunately, mosquito is a problem even in the room, mosquito electric repellent is available. It's small size mosquito and will give you a very itchy after they bite.Thing that can not be avoided in the shady and humid tropical condition.
title: Old but good service

text: Situated in a what appeared to be a restored Dutch colonial mansion, this hotel has it all except a pool. There is a wide room choice meeting any budget. Centrally located and the very friendly and accommodating staff are very helpful in setting up what ever travel needs you may have.
title: Very Nice

text:
My 1st experience was awesome, I booked using Agoda. 
But last time was my 2nd time there.  I checked in on the spot and choose Mungil room which is the smallest and cheapest room. The room is decent, with TV 14'' and the remote doesn't works well. 
Bathroom just like standard, no hot water and only standard facilities such as shower, towels, soap.. and that's all. 

My most concern is about the telephone. There was a phone, only a phone without any notes how to call the receptionist, restaurant, etc. I wanted to call the front man because they even didn't tell me any useful information such as wifi password ,how to lock the door because it was unusual and I got it in my 1st time. The electric plugs is far away from our bed, so there is no chance for you to use laptop or charge your phone in your bed. You have to either put it in the TV or stand up using it beside the TV.  

When I checked out, they even didn't check the room. Whether I stole their TV or something left there. 
I understand it is the cheapest room, but normally they should respect people no matter which room they booked. 
It makes me really unsure to come back even I know they are the best in Blitar so far. But with that quality service, I might choose stay in losmen or 1 star hotel with cheaper price but same service like I got in my 2nd time in Tugu.
title: a bit disappointed

text:
I spent just one night at this hotel before visiting my wife's family at a village near Blitar. I am still not sure if I saw all the facilities during my stay, as I was just shown to my room and a dining area for breakfast, so this is all I can comment on in this review.

On my arrival, the very pleasant man at reception stated that he did not speak very much English. But by comparison with other places I've been in East Java, he spoke very good English.

The rooms are all set back off the street with a paved driveway circling around and giving easy vehicular access right to the door of my room. There were very large trees and well maintained tropical gardens right in front of my room and the full-length colonial style window made for a very pleasant view and secluded feel from inside the room.

In front of each room was a table and two comfortable chairs, suitable for dining or having a drink outside. Inside, the room was larger than your average hotel room, with a huge bed with a proper inner-spring mattress (not standard in other Blitar hotels). The artwork on the walls and two high-backed ornate wooden chairs, upholstered in green velvet, certainly added charm and some sophistication to the room.

There was a large wash basin and mirror at the rear of the room with good lighting for make-up etc. There was also a reasonably sized separate bathroom with shower and western-style toilet.

The room was well appointed with a very quiet split system air-conditioner and a bar-fridge. I was there for many hours before I realised that the fridge was not cooling and found that it was turned off at the dial inside. This was a bit annoying as it was then hours later before it actually cooled anything down.

While the hotel was busy when I arrived it was very quiet that night, I could barely hear another sound from inside the room. I guess this is mainly due to the room being located so far back from the street and obviously the hotel is of a construction that limits the noise between the rooms. It was nice and peaceful for sleeping all night. 

In the morning, I was shown to a table for breakfast in a dining area just off the central driveway, just opposite reception. This area was screened from the driveway by an interesting veil of vines that form the natural screen. The area was well decorated with statues and artwork very similar to that seen in the Ubud region of Bali.

Included with my room was a choice of light breakfast of toast and jam, or a couple of traditional dishes. One traditional dish was described by the waiter as "chicken soup”. I ordered this and as I suspected it was soto ayam with all the usual side dishes of crackers and sauces with rice. The broth was full of chicken pieces and more that I would usually eat for breakfast (and I eat a lot!).

The Hotel Tugu at Blitar is a quiet, relaxing and charming hotel with a historic appeal. The staff were polite and at all times very helpful. My wife and I are regular visitors to Blitar, and now that I have experienced the Tugu, we will certainly book here for an extended period next time, given the very cheap rates for this standard of accommodation.
title: Comfortable, quiet old-style hotel with a touch of class and excellent customer service.

text:
This august we stayed one night in Hotel Tugu Blitar as a stopover between Kediri and Malang. We arrived in the early afternoon and were warmly welcomed. We stayed in the Tugu Suite in the main building. The main building is a very beautiful, colonial building. Our room was very big, authentic and clean and the bathroom has everything you need.
After a small walk in the city, I enjoyed a wonderful massage, while my husband enjoyed (free!!) tea with all kind of sweets. After the massage I joined him.

The hotel is in a busy street, but once you ride through the gate onto the courtyard it is completely quiet.

Lunch, dinner and breakfast in the restaurant was very good and we felt also very welcome there.

The staff of Hotel Tugu Blitar are excellent!! They also took very good care of our driver. We didn't like the city much, but the stay in the hotel made everything good.
title: Beautiful authentic hotel

text: We had previously been in the Hotel Tugu Malang so when we arrived I was a little disappointed but this hotel,  after a couple of nights we loved! It is quiet without the buzz of Tugu Malang but full of history. We had a room in the main building which was full of character with an partly outside bathroom. We felt that we were stepping back in time in this hotel. The staff were so so friendly and helpful. The food in the hotel was ok but the most special night was when we had a dinner in the grounds of Panataran temple. This was an incredible experience, not cheap but worth every penny.
title: Very special hotel

text:
Hotel Tugu Blitar is a bit of a poor cousin to the Hotel Tugu Malang. But WHAT a poor cousin it is! One of the best hotels for the price I have ever stayed in! Historic building. Exceptional art - sculptures, paintings, design, carvings. GREAT food and service. Yes, it's a bit run down. But so what. Look at the prices! Look at the rooms! Look at the location. This is the place to stay in Blitar. 

BTW, the eruption earlier in the year closed the viewing tunnel through the crater of Mt. Kelud. So our visit to it was a dud. Great temple on the way, though.
title: Wonderful

text:
Room is clean, has ethnic feel which is amazing, and the decoration is very conceptual. 
This is the best hotel in Blitar, with quick service and also friendly staff there. 
Better if you stay more than a night to feel more about the hotel atmosphere which is unique and peace.
title: Great

text:
I stayed at this hotel for my best friend's wedding, and it was my first trip to Blitar. I didn't believe that there is such a beautiful hotel in this town.
First time I entered the hotel, I could feel the peace and quiet behind the old dutch architecture building and its big trees.   The people and their services were good. 
It is right in the middle of the town, where you can explore the town easily. You can go for a walk to Aloon-Aloon, it is busy at night with many sellers or take a becak (a pedicab) to Karangsari where you can buy star fruits from its trees, or to Kebon Rojo (a kind of public park) for its big trees, and visit the Indonesian first president Mr. Soekarno's graveyard if you are interested in Indonesian History.
For sure, I will come back to this hotel!!
title: Come and feel the difference

text: I arrived as person who always travel with many great hotels, clean and sufficient. In Blitar, The room start from $17 -- $ 90. I found the room with $ 30 price line is amazingly well kept, very beautiful and charming. As a historian i am very intrigue with the fajar room in the main house, and also all decoration and pictures displayed. The staff are very friendly, the place is very clean and beautiful space.  The landscape brought back to the ideas of old indonesia but modern..In the early morning i went to the temple, CandiPenataran, lots of important relief relate with Panji, and after that i went to Soekarno grave yard (the first president) and see how the legacy of political leader became site of tourism. With Becak that cost 40,000 ID rupiahs..i also able to stp at pecel warung, a traditional food with lots of veggie and rice with peanut souse, and visit karangsari village where the star fruit farm in each house spread many hectars...I must confess that my trip brought a new hope of sustain food and traditional landscape and friendly people. More, this hotel is so near train station, and by becak you can reach the hotel in 5 minutes.
title: Historically very Rich: Travel as  New Knowledge

text: as my parents always keen into historical places throughout java, here we go as part of the family trip. fondest memory, this is the first hotel in town with a historical background since our first president was born here (also buried in this town) and he was a repeat visitor in this hotel. the owner put some interesting artifacts in the communal room and cafe, and the first president's suite is offer to the guests within well best kept condition. we had stayed in the south wing that newer built and enjoy the pictures collection and some memorabilia from the past.
title: colonial charm

text: During our journey in east Java, we stay in this very nice hotel in the city center but apart from the street circulation - maintained into an old little family palace - eight large ensuite rooms in the Palace + additional section with more rooms in the backyard  - good restaurant in the hotel entrance
title: Hotel TUGU SRI LESTARI

text: When I arrived in Blitar for the first time, it was so surprise for me to found a splendid hotel with traditional hospitality and warm regards from a small city. The food really amazing and quite different with another type of hotel that I've came. With realistic fare, I booked Tugu Suite Room which has fantastic traditional design. The hotel guys with friendly, also introduce Sang Fajar Room, which has historical moment for Indonesia 1st President, Soekarno. Overall, I'm so happy with all the service that they gave...
title: Excellent hospitality

text: After an endless ferry-bus-night train-jam packed economy train" trip, we really needed rest and choose to go to Tugu Lestari! When we arrive the beautiful vine driveway, staff and excellent lunch satisfied us right away. We took a medium priced room around 30$ that included a big double bed, hot water shower and nice furniture. The restaurant is excellent, the staff provided us a motorbike (a good one!) for the next day, to visit the beautiful Gunung Kelud and its hot springs. We were really satisfied. The hotel is like a little museum with javanese antiques and artcrafts in the beautiful lobby. Its located very close from the train station. Blitar is a pleasant town near amazing countryside, volcanoe, ricefields... Not very touristy wich we really appreciate! I you want to splurge, there is amazing suites for around 80$!!!
title: What a great surprise!

text: The Tugu Sri Lestari at jl. Merdeka is definitely the first hotel in town. Rooms are comfy (ask for a DeLuxe WITH hot water!) though a bit characterless. But they´re spotlessly clean, the service is perfect and there´s actually nothing to complain about. There´s a strong chinese influence in it´s style but never found out why. Only transport in Blitar are ojeks and bijars. The restaurant is ok, given the fact that there are absolutely no restaurants in this area. The hotel also offers a driver +guide to Penataran for about 650.000 IDR, though you might opt for a moto to get there (it ain´t too far).
title: Grand in charme and comfort

photos.caption: nice but a bit characterless rooms

text:
Driving down the vine-covered driveway, we were transported to a tranquil hideaway in the middle of a moderately hustle-bustle town in East Java.  We stayed in one of the Tugu Suites and loved the enormous 4-poster bed, fruit basket, friendly welcome note, and tasteful, comfortable furnishings.  Great old-world, colonial vibe.  The service at this antique-filled hotel was top-notch.  Loved that they reserved a breakfast table for us and that the staff knew our names.  Delicious food at the on site restaurant.  We splashed out and signed up for a very special sunset dinner the hotel can arrange at the nearby Hindu temple.  Once-in-a-lifetime kind of experience: private tour of the temple followed by a private dinner with private musician.  Very atmospheric.  Great food (presumably from the Tugu Hotel kitchen).  Highly recommended (for a special treat -- not inexpensive, but worth every penny!).

Blitar charmed us (in large part due to Tugu).  A smallish town (for heavily-populated Java).  Pleasant markets.  Good bakeries.  Kelud volcano is a worthwhile trip (as long as you don't mind a very dramatic and curvy drive).  Sukarno museum is a quick, modestly interesting stop. Penataran temple is full of lovely carvings in a beautiful setting and definitely worth a visit (especially at dusk).  We could have easily spent another day in town, enjoying the common areas at Tugu Blitar and, perhaps, visiting the nearby beaches.  Recommended for people looking for an off-the-beaten path experience.
title: Nice stop on a Central/East Java tour

text:
My son and I and some friends stayed at the Hotel Tugu in Blitar in August. It's a lovely place, where the busy sounds of the street fall away as you walk through the entrance and are immediately surrounded by old-fashioned courtesy and service. The furnishings reflect the fact that this is apparently the oldest hotel in Indonesia - I don't mean they're dodgy, just solidly classic and unpretentious. There were lots of lovely touches such as a personalised welcome to dinner, and the four-poster bed was good quality. The shower was a little eccentric (it jumped off the wall and soaked me and the entire bathroom before I was ready for it) but that was a minor quibble. The food was good, too. We saw round the Soekarno suite (couldn't quite afford to stay there!) and that was pretty magnificent.
The Soekarno museum and grave is well worth visiting - it's become a place of pilgrimage, and it's fascinating for anyone interested in Indonesian history.
title: Atmospheric Hotel Tugu

text: I love the Tugu Blitar Hotel. It is such an oasis of country charm in a busy, noisy country. The service was exceptional, I stayed in a large suite with a king size plus bed with comfortable mattress. I felt like Dutch royalty of 100 years ago. And all this for under $80/night. Top that off with a wonderful dinner of chicken cooked for 8 hours in palm sugar in a clay pot --- kjust divine. When I got home I spent the next 2 days trying to replicate the recipe. You should not pass up the opportunity to visit this historic boutique hotel.
title: Historical Indonesian Ambience

text:
This hotel is one of the highlights of this small East Java town. It is very atmospheric right from when you first enter along a vine-covered walk way and is filled with antiques and photos of a Java that no longer exists.

The hotel has rooms in a very broad price range; from 80,000rp to over 2,000,000rp. All of them are  good value. We stayed in the cheapest category and it was leagues better than any other hotel I have stayed in with a similar price due to such thoughtful touches as fresh flowers and magazines in the room  

We also looked at the more expensive suites and they are very beautiful  and loaded with original antiques. They would make for a very memorable stay.

The hotel restaurant is also very good and the service throughout the hotel is above average for Indonesia.
title: Splendid hotel

text:
Hotel Tugu Blitar can best be described as a hidden gem. My wife and I first stayed at the hotel in August 2016 when visiting family in Blitar. We have stayed there on each subsequent visit. The hotel is located in the heart of Blitar yet it is an oasis of tranquility. You enter though an enchanting natural canopy like travelling through time. The canopy gives way to a natural courtyard bounded by foliage and natural plants. A few steps up from the courtyard is the magnificent inner hall complete with wonderful floral displays. its here you find the most luxurious rooms as well as the historic Presidential suite. Rooms are furnished in traditional Javanese style where comfort and cleanliness sit side by side. Meals are taken in the elegant dinning room which has an open outlook to the canopy. It is here you can sample and enjoy the best of Javanese food served by friendly and attentive staff. What makes Hotel Tugu so special is its people. Their friendliness and professionalism are second to none. From the moment you arrive you are treated as one of the 'Tugu' family and given to feel special. We have visited all quarters of the globe and with all that experience under our belt no other hotel can compare to Tugu Blitar for the warmth of welcome and tranquil surroundings which has a special and indescribable beauty. Thank you to all for making our stay's so enjoyable and memorable.
John & Elaine Walker
UK
February 2023
title: A Hidden Gem

text:
We stayed here again recently and have been going to Blitar for about 8 years now and always book at the Hotel Tugu. The rooms are great and always very well presented. The staff are as helpful and friendly as you will find anywhere in Indonesia. There is plenty of room to park your car and as the rooms are out the back of the hotel away from the street, they are very quiet considering the hotel is in the middle of the city. 
On this trip I happened to ask at the desk if the TV in my room would get the ABC Australia channel as I was going to watch the football finals, although it was not important as I could stream the match on my laptop through the hotel wi-fi. To my very pleasant surprise, the next morning a new Samsung smart TV was installed in my room so I could live-stream the game on a large screen! This is just one example of how helpful the staff are and how they go out of their way to ensure that guests have a pleasant stay. 
Also, I get the breakfast included with the room which is always great too.

text:
I have been in Indonesia for my honeymoon and my sister (who has her own travel agency in Asia) advised me to spend a night at Tugu Blitar, not only for the wonderful staff, beautiful rooms, but especially for the lost temple dinner. And she wasn't wrong, it was magical! Everybody was very kind and helpful. You can get a tour around hotel and especially in the room where the family of Soekarno stays every year. We stayed at the Tugu Suite, which was amazing. It is even prettier in real than on the pictures. We have stayed in a lot of hotels during our honeymoon and the hotels we like best is if it combines luxury with Indonesian culture and atmosphere. Well, Tugu Blitar is one of those beautiful hotels. Also very nice breakfast with a lot of choice.

The lost temple dinner is worth every penny. You will be taken by a driver of the hotel to the temple where you will be able to visit and make pictures. When it gets darker, all the candles of the temple are lit outside and its magical! You will have a private dinner with a private waiter and private flutist. If you go with a group, you will also get Indonesian dance performances. Then the 3-course dinner is served, which is also beautiful. 

If you are in Indonesia, I would definitely recommend you to have this experience at Tugu Blitar.
title: Beautiful hotel with great staff and special lost temple dinner

text:
I was on my business trip to Blitar, East Java. I took flight to Malang, the nearest airport to Blitar. I had stayed in Malang so many times, so I decided to stay in Blitar and I found the Tugu Sri Lestari Hotel on the internet. 

I reached the hotel after a 2.5-hour drive from Malang. Honestly, I did not expect much from the hotel, but after arriving there I opened my eyes widely and said: "Ah, this must be a hidden sanctuary."

Blitar is small but historical city. Panataran Temple and Soekarno Grave can be found there. The hotel itself is really historical. It was built in late 1840s and there is a special suite called 'Sang Fajar' or The Dawn, the nickname for Indonesia's founding father: Soekarno.

I stayed in the Tugu Suite and really love the wide room. The bed is more than one meter high from the floor, so the guests need to step on wooden boxes available to climb to the bed. The hotel is not suitable for families with young children. 

A basket contained of selected tropical fruits was served to welcome me inside the room. After checking in, I enjoyed afternoon tea accompanied with Indonesian traditional snacks in a small cafe decorated like a Javanese kitchen in the past.

After the sun set, the hotel showed its romantic atmosphere with the lights around its artistic collections. The night cool air made my stay there more enjoyable.

My breakfast was very nice. They served a la carte breakfast, the guests could choose  Indonesian or American breakfast. I tried the signature Blitar pecel, a mix of vegetables and served with peanut sauce. The restaurant is near the main entrance, so during the breakfast guests will see many people (guests and hotel staff) crossing in front of them. It is an open restaurant with no wall and windows, so expect some noise during meal. But during my breakfast, there was a nice music played in the restaurant, and it helped me to be more relaxed.

The staff during check-in, afternoon tea, breakfast, and check-out were nice and helpful. They also kindly invited me to visit the 'Sang Fajar' suite, the most precious room in the hotel.

The hotel provides shuttle from Malang airport but I decided to take a rental car from Malang which was less expensive and allowed me to explore Blitar freely.
title: A Hidden Sanctuary in Historical Blitar

text: Although my wife & I are regular guests at the Tugu Hotels we had not stayed at Tugu Blitar before and our 3 nights stay in August were just wonderful. The basic core of the hotel is a beautiful old Dutch building and includes the room where the late President Sukarno stayed and wrote his memoirs. Our room was huge and just fabulous. Everything was classic and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. Ibu Hartini and her staff were so friendly and welcoming and we felt immediately at home. The traditional Javanese 'warung' was a wonderful spot to relax and have high tea and the staff arranged a fabulous meal and cake there for my wife on her birthday. The rooms and other buildings have been designed, decorated and influenced by the Tugu patriarch & owner Pak Anhar with his incredible taste in traditional Javanese architecture and decor with Dutch and Peranakan influences. The food was excellent and we so enjoyed our stay that we will definately be returning to Tugu Blitar again next year.
title: Beautiful Heritage Hotel

text: Tugu Hotel is just excellent. Comfortable and spacy rooms, stylish interior. Very good and fairly priced food at the restaurant. The personnel is very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is centrally located in Blitar but our room was perfectly quiet.

text:
Former Dutch colonial administrative building turned into a marvelous hotel. A very impressive example of the period as well with long collonades and tree lined enterance. More impressive still is that some of the original art deco period peices from the time are still there and in functioning (check out the metal lamps - masterpeices...).

Staff is sweet and always a joy to interact with. Value given the current exchange rates dollar v. Rupiah is unbeatable for time being. Food is fantastic. 

To get to Blitar try and go thru the area around Batu which is very beautiful. 

The ruins near Blitar are something of a disappointment after the area around Yogjakarta. But still worth a visit.
title: Colonial Gem Restored

text:
Its management apparently taken over by the Tugu group, whose flagship is the historic hotel in Malang, this Tugu in Blitar is an economy-priced chance to stay in a mid-19th-century property with great character and no snobbish pretensions. Originally a local aristocrat's mansion, the compound has a street-side building with two two areas divided by a vine-decked old carriage-way. It leads to the mansion, converted into one-bedroom suites, one of which was used by Indonesia's founding father, President Sukarno, whose photoes and books still decorate one suite. 
A splendid two-chambered spa was built at its back, well worth patronising if only to view the floor baths, antique utensils, local paintings and tree trunk that rises through the spa's roof. 
The side two-storeyed block of standard and deluxe air-conned en suite rooms have a full-length terrace and balcony with tables, chairs and greenery views, for chilling out (and smoking, depending on neighbours addictions). 
The key advantage of the tree-clad compound is the much smaller than usual impact of muezzin prayers, which are almost inaudible in the bedrooms.
The Colony Restaurant, in one of the columned front halls, decked out with original owning family relics, has a varied menu of Asian and Western dishes, reasonably priced and served smartly. Breakfast there is a good way to sample local specialities.
Be warned that Blitar does not have auto taxis. Transport is available from bicycle carriages, motorbike taxis, and hire cars with drivers.
title: Escape into historical calm in city midst

Stayed for a night with my family on a vacation trip to Blitar. Good old hotel with rich historical heritage. Rooms are OK, old but very well maintained. We had hot running water, cold AC, and a decent WiFi with strong signal albeit a bit slow 

Requested one hotel attendant to see the room where the first Indonesian President, Sukarno, used to stay in when he visited his family in Blitar back in the 50s and 60s. Great and grand room. I gave the attendant some tip for showing the historical hotel room, which is not really for a display to guests but you could request to check it out if you want to. 

Great breakfast with very nice selection. 

Overall a very nice stay. This hotel is indeed a very special one, much better staying there than in another much more modern hotel in the city with no such historical feel. Perfect combination if you also visit Sukarno's tomb and museum in Blitar.

Tugu Blitar is a stylish hotel. The dining room is beautifull. The mainbuilding is an attraction in it self: the rooms are big and in one of those rooms Soekarno stayed several times.
The building is old, and not renovated. The bathroom is not llike modern bathrooms, f.e. The sink is in the room, not in the bathroom and the showerhead is close to the toilet. We got used to,it.

text:
I have visited this hotel three times in the past ten years and never been disappointed. It has managed to preserve its 1950s ambience without getting shabby or neglected. Try to catch the gamelan concert at the weekend.  Musicians very natural, no ethnic outfits, some wear baseball caps! Also take afternoon tidbits in the little hideaway opposite the gamelan alcove. Superb selection of photographs of Bung Karno (Indonesia's first president). 

Public rooms are not air-conditioned,  but mosquitoes are few. 

Unique entrance arcade, consisting of hanging roots, I think, and they very effectively isolate the lobby from the nearby street.
title: You could come to Blitar just to stay at the Tugu

text: This beautiful historic hotel is a Tugu gem.  Don't miss  the Lost Temple Dinner. You dine (7-course meal) in an ancient temple under the stars.  The service was impeccable, the wine choice superb and the experience was unforgettable.  We had a lone flute player adding to the mystic and atmosphere of this most enchanting evening.  The friendliness of the staff and the way the Tugu understand service really defines the hotel.  If you love art and romance - this is the place for you. A "must stay" when travelling to East Java.  Be sure to check out the Sukarno museum and his private residence too.  Both are worth 1-2 hrs visit.   See the beautifully preserved temples and take your time.  I love Blitar. So glad I took the road less travelled and extended my Malang stay.
title: History and Art in East Java

text:
I've stayed in Tugu hotel with family for vacation in Blitar, actually I read few reviews before i decide to stay in this hotel, and I thought it's very interesting to stay in a hotel which has history with Sukarno. 
My family's first impression about the hotel was a bit spooky, but later on we found the hotel was very comfortable, ethnic with many art tastes (blend of china, Bali and java arts), and the staff were very kind, friendly and helpful, plus my sister and I really love their slipper, because they use bakiak (traditional sandal in java) instead of regular slipper.
And i also enjoyed the mini tour inside the President suite which in the past Sukarno often stayed in this room whenever he was visiting Blitar (based on what i remember from the tour explanation). And overall, we were impressed with the hospitality of the staff and we also thought that the foods are tasty in a modest way.
title: Comfy hotel and tasty snack

text:
We stayed here for three nights in early April and really loved the ambiance, the staff, and the attached restaurant. The hotel was not busy at this time and we found the staff very attentive and helpful. We loved its closeness to the train station, and to the Town Square, both very short distances. We also rented a scooter to visit the sites in the surrounding areas. 
The deluxe room was spacious, the bathroom was great with lots of hot water, and the complimentary afternoon tea with sweets was awesome. Definitely the best place to stay in Blitar. 
Although it is an older building, and showing its age, it's character and charm more than make up for it. We would definitely stay here again and look forward to it.
title: Older but still Classy.

text: A sister hotel to renowned boutique hotels in Malang and Canggu, Bali, the Blitar Tugu has wisely retained (or built) basic rooms to complement the sprawling and pricey colonial-era suites of the original property. As long as you are not trying to impress your travel companion, you can use a cramped but comfortable back room for sleeping and spend your time in one of the many antique-filled common areas. In all, a good introduction to the little-known but picturesque and friendly south route across East Java.
title: Budget Boutique Hotel

text:

owner_response.text:
Dear guest, first of all thank you for your comment and for having stayed with us.
We are sorry that you found your particular room small - I hope there was no misunderstanding and it had been clearly explained during the reservation process that we have 2 parts of the hotel: the Tugu part, which is the original 150 year old colonial building that contains 2 room categories (Tugu Suites and Sang Fajar Suite) which are 40m2 and 80m2 and decorated more in the Tugu style, and the Sri Lestari part, which is the newer structure surrounding the main Tugu colonial building, which contains 2 room categories: Deluxe rooms of 20m2 and Superior rooms of  21m2.. 
Safety box is always available in reception that all guests can use anytime and we also offer guests to leave his valuable items in reception for his convenience during stay with us.
Breakfast facilities is based on the room choice whereas; Suite includes American breakfast, while Deluxe and Superior include Indonesian breakfast but they can order American breakfast with additional charge.
We are very sorry for your unconvenience and we hope you will come again to have the better stay with us more than 1 night to arrange you the memorable experience in Blitar..

Best regards,
Suhartini

Dear Guests, 

Thank you for your constuctive feedbacks and very valuable input about our hotel to improve our offerings for guests.
Eagerly we will make improvements in all aspects in giving a good service. The Tugu Suite, the room you stayed is a room located in the main building which was built in colonial era in 1850 where we deliberately preserve it as evidence of Indonesian history.
We always try to maintain a more romantic atmosphere, however we have noted your comments and will work on improvements. We will be sure that music will be playing at the restaurant at all meal times as well.
For guest activity we offer a tour by car to some interesting places around Blitar such as; The Gebang Palace, Soekarno Graveyard, Karangsari Starfruit Plantation, Kelud Volcano, Rambut Monte Site, Embultuk Cave with full of stalagmite along 1,5 km, The South Coast Beaches and dine under the Full Moonlight, The Sawentar and Penataran Temple as the largest ancient Hindu temple in East Java built in the era of Majapahit Kingdom, and also a tour by bicycle, becak (tricycle) and Andong, a vehicle of wood drawn by a horse to discover the natural and cultural beauty of Blitar surrounding through the local village, with the framed view of emerald rice fields along the way to know the process of making traditional palm sugar and enjoy a night market in aloon-aloon approximately 200 meters from the hotel.

I have just returned recently from our trip to Surabaya - Blitar, I was there with my son, my sister and brother in law.

We spend 4 nights at Tugu Sri Lestari and I have to say that our stay there made our trip EXCELLENT.

During our second day there, it was my B.I.L's birthday and I decided to throw him a surprise after breakfast so I approached the hotel reception and made all the necessary arrangement.  The day come and I was overwhelmed.

I did not expect that it's going to be a tremendous surprise but it was... It is something that I would rate as 'Exceeding-Excellent' in the customer service world.  We were greeted with a personalized, hand written leaf that states 'Good morning to me and my family.' Tell me, how often your get such personalized greeting in the morning when you are on vacation.

We had our breakfast as per normal and subsequently without expecting anything... They brought out a cake and my B.I.L had a great smile carved on his face. At that moment I knew I made him a happy man and his birthday was a blast.

I m happy to see him and my sis happy on that very special day... couldn't thank the staffs enough... 

Rooms was cozy... Services was prompt... Staff is friendly and the place itself... spells TENSION-FREE.

I enjoyed waking up in the early morning... breathing the fresh, unpolluted air so fresh that I felt energized. 

Ask me if I going back there again... I 'll tell you bet I ll be there again.

I ll never forget my stay there and all the great experience which they have given me.

I ll be back soon.  That's for sure.
title: Thank you for the great hospitality!!!

text: This hotel provides a unique blend of five star hotel (lobby, restaurant, main building with a limited number of luxury suites) and average/simple hotel ('deluxe' and simple 'mungil' rooms), featured by its specific colonial style, and very clean all over. The charm of colonial 'tempo doeloe' is present in small things such as the soft background music in the restaurant, the traditional Javanese dress of the friendly waitors, or the afternoon tea offering snacks in the style of Javanese market vendors. Tugu Blitar's soul is the heritage of Indonesia's first president Soekarno, presented in a number of portraits decorating the walls. A gamelan set, played on Friday afternoons, lets you feel that you are really in Java. Tugu Blitar is the best 'base camp' for a trip to the ancient Panataran Temple, located about 10 km to the north and not yet well known among Westerners; the hotel offers a guided tour.
title: my beloved place of stay in Blitar

text:
This hotel stuffed with relics of fine Dutch colonial architecture - Chinese heritage and Javanese kampong tradition. It's full of history and character, especially if you are a fans of President Soekarno. If you are not, you will get charmed by his charisma through his inheritance in this building. The hotel is exceptionally clean, tasteful and well maintained. 

Staff are friendly and helpful and they even know names of each of the guest staying in. I was surprised when staffs greet me with my name. Not just typical good morning or other. 

We are not staying in the main building (the historic one), we aim for cheaper rate and rather modern one. We love the greenery surrounding and we also love the concept of semi open bathroom. We enjoy of art of taking bath with gayung, the water scooper.

The breakfast was good. And, they also provide free traditional tea time snacks in the afternoon time. 

We request for an early check in, since our train arrived in Blitar at 7am. We check in smoothly. No early check in fee! Call directly to the hotel for reservation and if you are lucky, you can have a generous discount:o)
